description:
The program crashes everytime I open it up with a disc drive mounted. Says that version 1.17.6 is out of date and need to update to 1.17.7 using links from a forum post from over 10 years ago. No MD5 checksums provided to verify download integrity on forum.

Pass on this.
Recently started using this software to rip some DVDs and it works excellent! It is so simple to use and lists all titles on the disc, amazing software
summary: Amazing, simple to use tool for ripping discs

description:
Version 1.17.6 is apparently 'outdated' and the program notifies you to download a newer version directly from the project's website. The notification gives you either an option to enter a REGISTRATION KEY or acknowledge the notification ('Okay') which immediately closes the program.

The latest version as of 2024-06-19 is 1.17.7 released on 2024-05-15 where the changelog states: "Version bump, no changes." Wow... (See for yourself: www [dot] makemkv [dot] com [slash] download [slash] history [dot] html)

The only way to obtain this version for Linux is to build from source, which for a newbie like me is inconvenient but I managed to make it work.
summary: Beta app detects itself as outdated and closes itself

description: Using the latest version, 1.17, opens but the system prompts to either force quit or wait, then shortly afterwards, crashes.
Failed to execute external program 'ccextractor' from location '/snap/makemkv/101/usr/bin/mmccextr'
summary: App opens but doesn't convert due to missing file

description: Ripped 1TB of blu-ray disks data that I own with no issues. Definitely useful if you are tired of using a blu-ray players.

Just like the title says, it's great for when you get a stubborn disk or ISO that wont just lie down and take it's reformatting as a man. This software will let you bend those video disk across your knee and teach them to be good little MKVs!
summary: Comes through when all other software Fails!

description: Got lucky and had a drive that could easily be flashed to support LIbreDrive installed already when I ran into an issue with the first 4k blu ray the inlaws gifted the kids. Since I don't want them to ruin the actual disk (and we don't have blu-ray players in the car...) I add all the kids movies to our Plex. Purchased MakeMKV a while ago when it was part of my windows ripping workflow and having it on Linux makes the transition that much easier.
It forces you out to download the latest version (1.6.7) from the website, since the Flathub version is too old (1.6.5). Please, update it as soon as possible.
summary: Outdated Flathub version, can't use it

description:
Installed with flatpak.

Won't start at all.

As stated on their website it does state that most distros ship an oudated evsion of ffmpeg and provides instructions on how to intall a newer version. At first it didn't work but after updating ffmpeg in does now work for ripping 4k
summary: Requires a newer version of FFmpeg

description: Worked perfectly on OpenSUSE Tumbleweed (2023-04-18). Saved my hair and nerves as VLC was driving me nuts not being able to play a .iso file on my Phone properly.
Not much else to say other than I have had zero issues with this application. Works great for DVD and Blu-Ray!
See above

Been using this for years to make backup of my DVDs and Blu-rays. Really nice it's available on Linux now. 

A little hint. If the program can't find the DVD drive, then run "modprobe sg". It will load the required kernel module.
I've used this program on Windows and bought a license. It works just the same on Fedora. Very happy!

I have been using this app for years and it nevers let me down. I even paid for a beta key to support the developers.

It is reliable and makes good rips. After ripping about 1,000+ discs over the years and watching all of them, I have never had a failed rip or a problem and that is pretty impressive.
summary: My Go-To for DVD, Bluray and UHD ripping

description: I have used this on Windows and Linux both. Currently I am running on Fedora 32. I have used this program on Ubuntu as well. Follow the installation instructions on the site and it works fine. I have made MKVs from hundreds of DVDs without issue.
summary: Excellent! I have used this for years and it always just works

its Mostly OK, slower than some but wont read previously ripped DvD

description: This software won't work no matter the DVD. using this software in Ubuntu. I don't see anyway to update the software either.

I use MakeMKV for ripping Blu ray and UHD disks to put them on my NAS so that they're easier to watch around my house. And it works well for that. You can get demo keys online, but I use it enough I bought the full key. Awesome to see it supported and updating on Linux.
summary: Does it's job with a changing landscape

description:
Just use the ppa! 

https://launchpad.net/~heyarje/+archive/ubuntu/makemkv-beta

Distrobution: ZorinOS Lite
Computer Architecture: i686 (32bit)
Four clicks and the backup process started. No complains
I used it to transfer my old dvd and it worked perfectly
This software worked for a bit then started saying the program can't find any usable optical drives.

With this application I managed to save damaged DVDs.
My little boy is enjoying his movies again.
But we have kept the original records to see and remember his little fingerprints and his beautiful paintings on them.
Using this software for many years now, not one DVD / Blueray it could not crack and save to disk. Perfekt!
everything is fine but sometimes it doesn't like to code subtitles into and with mkv files

Worked great for ripping a bunch of Blue-Ray discs I had so I could actually watch them! It's a proprietary, paid app with a trial, but if it works for you it's well worth the cost to support their efforts IMO.

I always put this on my computers, and on linux installations I do for my friends and family. It never lets me down, but may have problems on DVD burners trying to read discs purchased overseas - different regions. But this usually handles dvds handbrake has problems with.

I use Handbrake to convert MKVs to mp4, and also reduce the size of files. Together, these two programs work wonders.

A few bucks for the guys that create these programs (apps) will go a long way to support them and see more of this kind of work happening.
summary: Have this on all my computers, brilliant!

description: I've been using MakeMKV for over 10 years now and I couldn't be happier. Nothing else on the market competes with MakeMKV. Somehow it's still in beta despite working flawlessly for a decade accross Linux, Mac, and my PCs - I assume this is because the author is a saint and doesn't want to charge for their work. If you're looking to rip DVD/Blu Ray movies this is the way to go.
This is not free software, after a month it shuts down unless you buy a key.
I have been using this for a few years now and love it. Currently it prompts me that there is a newer version. How do we get the latest version?
summary: Love this, but how do we get the updates?

description: It was once a great application. however of late my Mkv files will not play in VLC. Yet ones I've had for ages do. I am not sure whats going on there.
make mkv aplication is super speed working.

I have used this product many years as a subscribed user. The technology works and has a great community behind it as new releases are made. And thank you for the snap! This has greatly simplified updates. Keep up the great work!
Works almost as good as it does in Windows. Java needs to be updated in the snap for better correct title identification.
summary: Work well, but java needs to be updated

description: this version cannot be used anymore. It tells you to go download it from the website.
Includes all the necessary libaries to rip personal DVDs and Blu-rays to MKV
After you download they want $$$$$$ to activate. Lots of cheaper propriety that tells you up front they want money.
makes you download a new version on the website for which there is no Linux version
I was using this to make the few blu-ray discs I have viewable. I only have 3 discs. US$60 is a lot for only 3 discs. I would give maybe US$5 for the limited use I made of this.

MakeMKV is brilliant. I've used it on Windows for about 4 years. I just installed it on Ubuntu 20 and it's ripping a BluRay I own right now. No problems.

And for intermittent use, it's free. You just have to get the most current version and a new key about every 4-6 weeks

Here’s how to get a registration number that will expire monthly and costs nothing

When you’ve installed MakeMKV and you open it, you’ll get a small window that says “Register”. (Ignore all other messages.)

Do a Google search for ‘MakeMKV registration number’. The first search result is usually “MakeMKV is free while in beta”. 

Go there. You’ll see a long-ass serial number with a “Select all” button above it. Click Select All, and it will highlight the line. Hover your mouse over the line and right click, choosing the “Copy” option.

Then, go back to your MakeMKV window, click on the Register button, mouse right-click and paste your registration number into the registration number window. 

You’ll get a message to restart the application, and it will all work perfectly.

To the developer: start a Patreon page. I’d send you $5 every now and again, but $60 is a bit out of my range. I’m prepared to get a new beta registration number for the amount of use I make of MakeMKV.
summary: How to get a free registration number that will last a month

description:
As of downloading, the version installed was the most recent one. 
Software is free while in beta - key can be found in the makeMKV forum.
Läuft prima, bin sehr zufrieden
funktioniert nicht

Ein Klasse Programm für die Videoarchivierung.

Die Flathub-Variante hat jedoch einen kleinen Bug. 
Die laufende Anwendung verhindert nicht den automatischen Standby-Modus, so dass der PC nach der eingestellten Zeit in den Standby geht obwohl der Kopiervorgang noch nicht abgeschlossen ist.
Ich hoffe das wird bald behoben. Sonst top!
MakeMKV macht genau das was es soll. DVD einlesen, Tracks auswählen und als mkv Datei in bester Qualität super schnell auf die Festplatte kopieren.

Habe damit schon mehrere DVD's und Blueray aus meiner Sammlung gesichert.
Sehr übersichtlich, kurze Einarbeitungszeit und läuft bis jetzt stabil. Weiter so!
summary: Bluray and DVD Backup leicht gemacht

description: Liest gar keine BlueRays. Außerdem muß man nach 30 Tagen eine Lizenz erwerben. Ich frage mich wofür? Programm sofort wieder deinstalliert!
wasn scheiß tztztz...

MakeMKV hat einige Tage gut funktioniert, danach erschien eine Meldung, das Programm sei zu alt und man solle eine neue Version laden. Danach es beendete sich selbst. Eine neuere Version gibt es aber nur im Forum(?!) des Herstellers.

Ich verwende nun Handbrake, was auch DVDs dekodieren kann, wenn man zusätzlich das Paket »libdvd-pkg« installiert. Damit wird Auslesen und Shrinken auf einen Schritt reduziert.
Diverse BluRay und DVD damit gesichert; top!

Eine hervorragende, schnelle Decoder-Software, die sämtliche DVDs und die meisten BluRays ausliest und in MKV-Container überführt (inklusive Kapitelstruktur und gewünschter Sprac hen und Untertitel)

Aber … es ist proprietäre Software und kommt mit einem nervigen Nagscreen der nach 30 Tagen die Weiternutzung unterbindet. Alles in allem nicht ganz "the Linux way".

ABER … das Programm befindet sich seit einigen Jahren im Betastadium und im Forum des Anbieters (unter https://forum.makemkv.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=5&t=1053 )gibt es einen regelmäßig aktualisierten kostenfreien Beta-Lizenzschlüssel zur Verlängerung. Den muß man dann regelmäßig da abholen, kann aber das Programm nutzen, solange es in der Betaphase bleibt.

Die Bezahlversion ist derzeit nur nötig, um besonders hochauflösende BluRays zu verarbeiten. Ich mag Bezahlsoftware und solche Shareware-Ansätze gar nicht (nicht nur weil es etwas kostet, sondern wegen der vielen unseriösen Geschäftsmodelle die aus dieser Denke entstehen) aber wenn die Beta einmal endet würde ich den Kauf hier trotzdem in Erwägung ziehen. Ein überzeugendes Stück Software-Igenieurskunst.
Unbrauchbares Zeug

Meine Zusammenfassung beschreibt es schon, mehr kann ich leider nicht berichten. Ich hatte es installiert und nur die Meldung bekommen das das Programm veraltet ist und ich eine Registrierung durchführen müsste. Ich hatte es dann wieder deinstalliert.
summary: Programm ist veraltet, startet nicht, erfordert Registrierung

description:
Anmerkung zur Rezension von Thomas Steinhop:
Snap-Version heute: 1.17.5
Aktuelle Version: 1.17.6
Registrieren: Einfach im MakeMKV- Forum (https://forum.makemkv.com/forum/viewtopic.php?t=1053) den aktuellen Key (Aktuell kostenlos) kopieren und einfügen. MakeMKV neu starten und die Snap-Version kann genutzt werden.
summary: Nutze es seit vielen Jahren. Sehr gut
